alert.note: Alert for Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 9:39AM EDT until July 01 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT/1015 AM EDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN WARRICK AND EASTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 838 AM CDT/938 AM EDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Washington to 6 miles east of Winslow to near Lynnville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Winslow, Folsomville and Spurgeon. This includes Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 40 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
